meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Anna Pasquale John Compton Nanette Wargo Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #4003.

td.p: Anna Pasquale, a web consultant for an advertising agency from Sacramento, California
John Compton, a graduate student from Washington, D.C.
Nanette Wargo, a graduate student from Sauk Village, Illinois (whose 2-day cash winnings total $38,430)

tr.td: "ANTI" UP
JOKERS
JACKS OR BETTER
STRAIT
FULL HOUSE
ROYAL FLUSH

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [seeing Anna\'s response] You were on your way to writing "Tennessee," but you didn\'t, so we can\'t accept it.)
JohnWhat are Mississippi & Alabama?
$4,000
AnnaWhat are Mississippi & Ten
$5,700
NanetteWhat are Mississippi and Tennessee?
$800
Mississippi & Tennessee')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'The 2 states whose names each contain 3 sets of double letters; they border each other')

tr.td: THE 50 STATES
The 2 states whose names each contain 3 sets of double letters; they border each other
Nanette
John
Anna
3-day champion: $53,030
2nd place: trip to Cabo San Lucas, Mexico & stay at Pueblo Bonito Rose
3rd place: trip to Atlantic City & stay at Resorts Hotel
Nanette
John
Anna

21 R
(including 1 DD),
1 W

7 R,
3 W

15 R,
4 W
(including 2 DDs)

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
